channel.title: My Blog Posts on Rob Wiederstein - a blog about coding, data and public policy
channel.description: Recent content in My Blog Posts on Rob Wiederstein - a blog about coding, data and public policy

item.title: Code Highlighting in Rmarkdown
item.description: Example 1 Example 2 Example 1 # Dr Seuss a <- 1:2 fish.number <- paste(a, "fish", sep ="_") b <- c("red", "blue") fish.color <- paste(b, "fish", sep = "_") print(c(fish.number, fish.color)) ## [1] "1_fish" "2_fish" "red_fish" "blue_fish" Example 2 data(mtcars) p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(hp,mpg, group = factor(cyl), color = factor(cyl))) p <- p + geom_point() p <- p + ggtitle("Mtcars") p Figure 1: A plot constructed with ggplot2.

item.title: Ten Tips to Working with Blogdown
item.description: Introduction Ten Tips Best Resources Introduction Transitioning to hugo is difficult. Blogdown offers the promise of an easy and quick workflow for blogging, however, that is not the case. If youâ€™re not ready for some hard work, then you should probably stay with Wordpress or Squarespace. On the otherhand, if you want to understand the principles that underly much of webpage creation, then stick with blogdown and hugo.
